isis.stitle: TSI 08-13-01 - Manual Shift Lever Jumps Out of Gear

subjectgroup.subject: Manual Shift Lever Jumps Out of Gear

geninfo.para: The manual shift lever in cab may intermittently jump out of gear. This could be a result of interference between the lower shift boot and the shift tower stub shaft. A new lower shift boot is available which eliminates this interference.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury or death, shift transmission to neutral or park, set parking brake, and block wheels before doing diagnostic or service procedures.

step1.para: Remove upper shift lever boot that is visible from inside the cab to gain access to the lower shift boot.
Disconnect the upper shift lever from the lower stub shaft by removing the bolt at the gear shaft pinion bushing (Stick Isolator).
Replace lower shift boot with new style boot #3675966C1
Reassemble upper and lower shift levers by reinstalling bolt at pinion bushing and torque nut to 24 to 27 lbs. ft.
Slide upper boot back down and fit into new lower shift boot.
Test drive and verify that jump out issue has been eliminated.
